explanation: MHD_lookup_connection_value directly calls MHD_lookup_connection_value_n. To determine whether the target violates the MISRA recursion rule (no direct or indirect self-calls) you must inspect the implementation of MHD_lookup_connection_value_n to see if it (a) calls MHD_lookup_connection_value directly or (b) calls other functions that eventually call MHD_lookup_connection_value (i.e. forms an indirect cycle). If MHD_lookup_connection_value_n itself calls other functions, their bodies would also need to be examined, but the immediate and necessary symbol to begin the recursion analysis is MHD_lookup_connection_value_n.
